intro: Daviesia laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with woody stems. The plant produces small, pink to red flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Daviesia laxiflora is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in heathlands and dry forests.
